wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Michael George Henry Barker   (15 October 1884 – 21 May 1960) was a British Army officer who fought in both world wars, notably as commander of I Corps during the Battle of France in May 1940.

response: *Major-General Michael George Henry Barker,  Colonel, The York and Lancaster Regiment, Director of Recruiting and Organization, The War Office.
*Captain and Brevet Major Michael George Henry Barker, Lincolnshire Regiment
*Capt. and Bt. Major Michael George Henry Barker  Lincolnshire Reg.
